item.title: 英伟达™（Nvidia）人工智能服务器制造商鸿海两个月销售额增长25
item.description: 鸿海精密工业股份有限公司在2025年前两个月的收入增长了25%，比去年有所加快，反映出人工智能计算需求的扩大。【原文：Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. posted a 25% rise in revenue during the first two months of 2025, quickening from last year in a reflection of expanding demand for AI computing.】

item.title: 印度掉期利率创 2022 年以来最低，宽松政策押注提前
item.description: 受当地通胀缓解和经济增长担忧的影响，投资者对印度提前降息进行了定位。【原文：Investors are positioning for earlier rate cuts in India, driven by easing local inflation and concerns over economic growth.】

item.title: 尽管特朗普反对电动汽车，三星仍考虑在美国建电池厂
item.description: 韩国三星 SDI 公司表示，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）取消了对电动汽车的补贴，但该公司仍对美国市场的增长持乐观态度。【原文：South Korea’s Samsung SDI Co. said it’s weighing the idea of another manufacturing plant in the US, signaling optimism about the market’s growth despite President Donald Trump rolling back subsidies for electric vehicles.】

item.title: 德国债券收益率因投资计划飙升至 2022 年以来最高点
item.description: 由于投资者担心为国防和基础设施投资提供资金的借贷会出现历史性增长，德国债券大幅下跌。【原文：German bonds slumped as investors braced for an historic increase in borrowing to fund defense and infrastructure investment.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市将加入欧洲股市反弹的行列
拜耳预计利润将因农产品价格低迷而再次下滑
item.description: 拜耳公司预测利润将连续第三年下降，因为这家德国公司正努力应对美国的大规模诉讼、农产品价格下滑以及一些畅销药品面临的新竞争。【原文：Bayer AG forecast a third straight year of falling profit as the German company struggles with mass litigation in the US, slumping prices for agriculture products and fresh competition for some of its best-selling medicines.】

item.title: 软银支持的 Cybereason 首席执行官在董事会动荡后辞职
item.description: Cybereason Inc. 的首席执行官已经下台，因为他与投资者软银集团（SoftBank Group Corp.【原文：Cybereason Inc.’s chief has stepped down following a months-long feud with investors SoftBank Group Corp. and former US Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin that’s stalled decision-making at the cash-strapped startup.】

item.title: 阿布扎比建筑公司着眼于首次公开募股，以利用阿联酋的房地产热
item.description: 阿拉伯建筑公司（Arabian Construction Co.【原文：Arabian Construction Co. is considering an initial public offering in the United Arab Emirates, the latest firm looking to capitalize on the country’s booming property market.】

item.title: 李嘉诚以 190 亿美元现金退出全球港口业务
item.description: 李嘉诚做交易的历史由来已久。最近的交易是这位 96 岁老人最大胆、也是最受欢迎的交易之一。【原文：Li Ka-shing has a long history of doing deals. The latest is one of the 96-year old’s boldest — and best received.】

item.title: 特朗普聚焦韩国 "高于中国 "的关税水平
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统指出，韩国对美国产品征收的关税比中国更不公平，同时抨击韩国向三星电子公司等外国芯片制造商发放补贴。【原文：President Donald Trump pointed to South Korea as a country with more unfair tariffs against American products than China, while slamming the handing out of subsidies for foreign chipmakers like Samsung Electronics Co.】

item.title: 经事实核查的特朗普关于美国经济的言论
item.description:
在概述第二个任期的目标时，总统就关税等话题发表了自己的观点，但这些观点并没有得到经济指标和研究的支持。【原文：

Outlining goals for his second term, the president asserted his opinion on topics such as tariffs that aren't supported by economic indicators and research.

】

item.title: 格陵兰选民权衡选举中最重要的问题：特朗普
item.description:
美国总统对北极岛屿的兴趣动摇了3月11日投票的竞选活动。【原文：

The US president’s interest in the Arctic island has shaken up campaigning for the March 11 vote.

】

item.title: 我们即将见证 "特朗普套餐 "是否真实存在
item.description:
关税验证了市场可以作为经济政策否决权的信念。【原文：

Tariffs test belief that markets can act as a veto on economic policy.

】

item.title: 欧盟 8000 亿欧元国防预算是正在酝酿的债券骚动
item.description:
欧盟的重整军备计划将首当其冲地落在债券市场的肩上。这意味着借贷成本将大幅提高。【原文：

The brunt of the EU’s plan to rearm will fall on the shoulders of bond markets. That means sharply higher borrowing costs.

】

item.title: 无烟雾、更廉价的英国会是什么样子
item.description:
只要政府加强沟通，前景是美好的。【原文：

The outlook is good, if only the government steps up communication.

】

item.title: Spotify 联合创始人的激进主义公司向新投资者敞开大门
item.description: 这家由 Spotify Technology SA 的亿万富翁、联合创始人马丁-洛伦松（Martin Lorentzon）支持的激进主义公司正在寻求外部资金，以建立其投资中小型上市公司的战略。【原文：The activist firm backed by Martin Lorentzon, the billionaire co-founder of Spotify Technology SA, is seeking external funds to build out its strategy of investing in small to medium-sized listed companies.】

item.title: 丹麦丹斯克银行称丹麦预算仍有增加国防开支的空间
item.description: 北欧国家最大的银行表示，丹麦暂时有能力在不危及财政稳定的情况下将国防开支提高到目前计划的水平。【原文：Denmark can temporarily afford boosting defense spending more than currently planned without jeopardizing fiscal stability, the Nordic nation’s largest bank said.】

item.title: 中国全国人大为受特朗普举动影响的市场带来喜忧参半的结果
item.description: 市场观察人士对中国的经济目标反应不一，一些人称赞中国政府致力于实现 5%左右的增长目标，而另一些人则对基本保持一致的预测缺乏任何重大的积极惊喜感到遗憾。【原文：China’s economic goals drew a mixed response from market watchers, with some lauding Beijing’s commitment to a growth target of about 5% and others ruing that the largely in-line projections lacked any major positive surprises.】

item.title: 印度最大交易所出人意料地调整衍生品到期日
item.description: 印度最大的证券交易所--印度国家证券交易所有限公司出人意料地将其上市股票衍生品的到期日从周四改为周一。【原文：India’s largest bourse, the National Stock Exchange of India Ltd., unexpectedly changed the expiration day for its listed equity derivatives to Mondays from Thursdays.】

item.title: 出售股权后，对长江和记的乐观押注价值跃升 28,700
item.description: 长江和记黄埔控股有限公司（CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd. ）向贝莱德集团（BlackRock Inc.【原文：Call options on CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd. that traded on Feb. 18 are now worth 28,700% more after shares jumped following the sale of a subsidiary’s port stakes to a consortium led by BlackRock Inc.】

item.title: 吉利签署 24 亿欧元贷款，为沃尔沃卡车交易再融资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国亿万富翁李书福的浙江吉利控股集团有限公司（Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co.【原文：Chinese billionaire Li Shufu’s Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co. has obtained a syndicated loan to refinance borrowings related to its 2018 acquisition of a stake in Volvo AB, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 韩国水电公司出售亚洲首笔核能绿色债券
item.description: 韩国的韩国水电与核电公司（Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power Co.【原文：South Korea’s Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power Co. issued the first green bond in Asia whose proceeds can be used to finance nuclear energy projects, according to the company.】

item.title: 中国国会承诺解决钢铁和燃料生产过剩问题
item.description: 中国政府希望重组经济，实现强劲的增长目标，因此中国承诺解决钢铁和石油行业生产过剩的问题，这两个行业是中国表现最差、污染最严重的行业。【原文：China pledged to address the overproduction crippling its steel and oil sectors, two of the country’s worst-performing and most-polluting industries, as the government looks to reconfigure its economy and meet robust growth targets.】

item.title: 迪斯尼裁减 6% 的 ABC 电视网和娱乐电视员工
item.description: 根据一份内部备忘录，华特迪士尼公司将在其 ABC 和娱乐电视网络中裁员约 200 人。【原文：Walt Disney Co. is eliminating roughly 200 jobs across its ABC and entertainment TV networks, according to an internal memo.】

item.title: Andreessen 领投的基金为 Flock Safety 估值 75 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，风险投资公司 Andreessen Horowitz 将领投初创公司 Flock Safety 的一轮融资，该公司是一家著名的车牌读取摄像头制造商，估值约为 75 亿美元。【原文：Venture firm Andreessen Horowitz is set to lead a funding round for the startup Flock Safety, a prominent maker of license plate-reading cameras, valuing the company at about $7.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 软银支持的 Cybereason 首席执行官在董事会动荡后辞职
item.description: 软银集团（SoftBank Group Corp.）支持的赛博瑞森公司（Cybereason Inc.【原文：SoftBank Group Corp.-backed Cybereason Inc.’s chief executive officer has stepped down after a boardroom battle erupted at the cash-strapped startup.】

item.title: 中国在经济计划中推介雄心勃勃的西藏大坝项目
item.description: 中国表示计划在西藏的一条主要河流沿岸修建一个水力发电项目，这引发了人们对一个巨型水坝的猜测，而这将考验中国的工程技术和外交智慧。【原文：China has signaled plans for a hydropower project in Tibet along one of the region’s main rivers, fanning speculation of a mega-dam that would test its engineering and diplomatic nous.】

item.title: 日本央行副行长暗示将加息，但不急于加息
item.description: 日本央行副行长内田伸一在讲话中表示，基准利率仍处于逐步上调的轨道上，这可能会平息市场对日本央行提前行动的猜测。【原文：Bank of Japan Deputy Governor Shinichi Uchida signaled that the benchmark interest rate remains on a gradual upward path, in remarks that may quell speculation of an early move.】

item.title: 中国将强制削减钢铁产量以缓解过剩并恢复利润
item.description: 中国将推动本国钢铁行业减产，以缓解大规模过剩，恢复钢厂的盈利能力。【原文：China will push the country’s steel industry to cut output, in an attempt to ease a massive glut and restore profitability at mills.】

item.title: 碧桂园错过自我设定的债务重组目标日期
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，碧桂园控股有限公司（Country Garden Holdings Co.【原文：Country Garden Holdings Co. has missed a self-imposed target date to reach a deal on its debt restructuring plan, as the defaulted builder struggles to gain support from creditors, according to people familiar with the matter.】
